column4: im having problems with the download speed of azureus (and any other bittorrent client) in feisty. someone knows how to fix this?

adjust your bittorrent values,  azureus has a nice page for that,  ask in #azureus-support  and donT' expect to always dl at max speed with bittorrent,  speeds vary widely from torren to torrent,  and don't max out your ul speed you kill your dl
my bt values are ok, i set it with the values that it had in dapper
in install it with a simple sudo aptitude install amsn and when im type amsn in a terminal the promt says "core dumped" or something alike
#ubuntu-effects #compiz-fusion ,  you sometimes need to be patient , not all channels are as well attended as this one
can you be a little more specific about the nature of the problem ?

when the burning process is at its 25% (i know that by looking at the DVD after the proccess basically crash) it stops and quote a mkisof problem and after that it says that the proccess succeed but isn't
the proccess crash but not the app itself
did you upgrade your distro or just update the packages ?
i thought i wasn't the only one :(
don't know , sorry, try sudo apt-get update, sudo apt-get upgrade make sure that everything is the latest,  that's all I can recommend
maybe there is somethig about it in the forum
